clinical_study.brief_title: Patients' Knowledge and Understanding of Cancer Clinical Trials - a Study of Audio Recorded Information
clinical_study.official_title: Patients' Knowledge and Understanding of Cancer Clinical Trials - a Randomised Study of Audio Recorded Information

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test if cancer patients who are informed about, and offered participation in a cancer clinical trial, are more knowledgeable about cancer clinical trials if they have access to an audio recording of their information visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Patients' knowledge about clinical trials measured by the questionnaire Quality of Informed Consent
primary_outcome.time_frame: The questionnaire is sent to patients within a week after consenting to the trial.
primary_outcome.description: The questionnaire is sent to patients within a week after consenting to the trial. One reminder is sent to those not responding within two weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients' perceived understanding of clinical trials measured by the questionnaire Quality of Informed Consent
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The questionnaire is sent to patients within a week after consenting to the trial.
secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire is sent to patients within a week after consenting to the trial. One reminder is sent to those not responding within two weeks.

arm_group.description: Patients receive a copy of the audio recorded information about the clinical trial directly after the clinical visit. This makes it possible to repeat the information before a decision is made to participate in the clinical trial or not.
Patients in the control arm receive no copy of the audio recording.

intervention.description: Access to the audio recorded information about the clinical trial the patient was information about and asked to consider. A copy of the audio recording is given to the patients directly after the clinical visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed in Swedish about a phase II or III clinical trial
- Signed a consent form
